IP.Name: FREERTOS
IP.About: FREERTOS: Free Real Time Operating System

Condition.Diagnostic: Security belt when ramSize fetched is null

RefParameter.Name: MIN_PRIO_IN_USE
RefParameter.Comment: Min Prio used by freertos tasks (middleware ones and user ones)

RefParameter.Name: configUSE_PREEMPTION
RefParameter.Description: Set to 1 to use the preemptive RTOS scheduler, or 0 to use the cooperative RTOS scheduler.

RefParameter.Name: configCPU_CLOCK_HZ
RefParameter.Description:
This must be set to the frequency of the clock that drives the peripheral used to generate the kernels periodic tick interrupt.
This is very often, but not always, equal to the main system clock frequency.

RefParameter.Name: configTICK_RATE_HZ
RefParameter.Description:
Sets the tick interrupt frequency. The value is specified in Hz.
Warning:
The max value is 1000, as higher values generate compilation errors (division by zero)

RefParameter.Name: configMAX_PRIORITIES

Condition.Diagnostic: Limited to 32 when configUSE_PORT_OPTIMISED_TASK_SELECTION is Enabled

RefParameter.Description:
2 Sets the maximum priority that can be assigned to a task.
Tasks can be assigned a priority from zero, which is the lowest priority, to (MAX_PRIORITIES-1), which is the highest priority.

RefParameter.Name: configMAX_PRIORITIES
RefParameter.Description:
4 Sets the maximum priority that can be assigned to a task.
Tasks can be assigned a priority from zero, which is the lowest priority, to (MAX_PRIORITIES-1), which is the highest priority.

RefParameter.Name: configMINIMAL_STACK_SIZE

Condition.Diagnostic: Default value set to 96 for a target with only 4K RAM

RefParameter.Description:
Sets the size of the stack allocated to the idle task. The value is specified in words, not bytes.
Warning:
The value chosen by the user should take into account the number of threads, the total heap size and the system stack size. If the totality of used stack size is higher than the total heap size, FreeRTOS will not be able to create and manage the tasks.
For information: max value = configTOTAL_HEAP_SIZE/4

RefParameter.Name: configMINIMAL_STACK_SIZE
RefParameter.Description:
Sets the size of the stack allocated to the idle task. The value is specified in words, not bytes.
Warning:
The value chosen by the user should take into account the number of threads, the total heap size and the system stack size. If the totality of used stack size is higher than the total heap size, FreeRTOS will not be able to create and manage the tasks.
For information: max value = configTOTAL_HEAP_SIZE/4

RefParameter.Name: configMAX_TASK_NAME_LEN
RefParameter.Description: Sets the maximum number of characters that can be used for the name of a task. The NULL terminator is included in the count of characters.

RefParameter.Name: configUSE_16_BIT_TICKS
RefParameter.Description:
The tick count is held in a variable of type portTickType.
When USE_16_BIT_TICKS is set to 1 (Enabled), portTickType is defined to be an unsigned 16-bit type.
When USE_16_BIT_TICKS is set to 0 (Disabled), portTickType is defined to be an unsigned 32-bit type.
Using a 16-bit type can greatly improve efficiency on 8-bit and 16-bit microcontrollers, but at the cost of limiting the maximum block time that can be specified.
Warning:
Forced to 0 (Disabled) as the STM32 architecture is a 32 bit one.

RefParameter.Name: configIDLE_SHOULD_YIELD
RefParameter.Description:
IDLE_SHOULD_YIELD controls the behavior of the idle task if there are application tasks that also run at the idle priority.
It only has an effect if the preemptive scheduler is being used.
- if IDLE_SHOULD_YIELD is set to 0, then the idle task will never yield to another task, and will only leave the Running state when it is preempted.
- if IDLE_SHOULD_YIELD is set to 1, then the idle task will never perform more than one iteration of its defined functionality without yielding to another task if there is another idle priority task that is in the Ready state. This ensures a minimum amount of time is spent in the idle task when application tasks are available to run.

RefParameter.Name: configUSE_MUTEXES
RefParameter.Description: Set to 1 to include mutex functionality in the build, or 0 to omit mutex functionality from the build.

RefParameter.Name: configUSE_RECURSIVE_MUTEXES
RefParameter.Description: Set to 1 to include recursive mutex functionality in the build, or 0 to omit recursive mutex functionality from the build.

RefParameter.Name: configUSE_COUNTING_SEMAPHORES
RefParameter.Description: Set to 1 to include counting semaphore functionality in the build, or 0 to omit counting semaphore functionality from the build.

RefParameter.Name: configQUEUE_REGISTRY_SIZE
RefParameter.Description:
The queue registry has two purposes, both of which are associated with RTOS kernel aware debugging:
1.It allows a textual name to be associated with a queue for easy queue identification within a debugging GUI.
2.It contains the information required by a debugger to locate each registered queue and semaphore.
The queue registry has no purpose unless you are using a RTOS kernel aware debugger.

RefParameter.Name: configUSE_APPLICATION_TASK_TAG
RefParameter.Description:
USE_APPLICATION_TASK_TAG must be defined as 1 for the vTaskSetApplicationTaskTag function to be available.
This function is intended for advanced users only.
A 'tag' value can be assigned to each task. This value is for the use of the application only - the RTOS kernel itself does not make use of it in any way.
The FreeRTOS trace macros documentation page provides a good example of how an application might make use of this feature.

RefParameter.Name: configTOTAL_HEAP_SIZE

Condition.Diagnostic: Values for an MCU with 4K of RAM

RefParameter.Description:
The total amount of RAM available to the RTOS kernel.
TOTAL_HEAP_SIZE setting has no effect unless heap_1.c, heap_2.c or heap_4.c are being used by the application (see Memory Management scheme parameter for more information).
Warning:
The value chosen by the user should take into account the application consumption of RAM otherwise it will lead to link issues!
For information: min value = configMINIMAL_STACK_SIZE*4

RefParameter.Name: configTOTAL_HEAP_SIZE
RefParameter.Description:
The total amount of RAM available to the RTOS kernel.
TOTAL_HEAP_SIZE setting has no effect unless heap_1.c, heap_2.c or heap_4.c are being used by the application (see Memory Management scheme parameter for more information).
Warning:
The value chosen by the user should take into account the application consumption of RAM otherwise it will lead to link issues!
For information: min value = configMINIMAL_STACK_SIZE*4

RefParameter.Name: configTOTAL_HEAP_SIZE
RefParameter.Description:
The total amount of RAM available to the RTOS kernel.
TOTAL_HEAP_SIZE setting has no effect unless heap_1.c, heap_2.c or heap_4.c are being used by the application (see Memory Management scheme parameter for more information).
Warning:
The value chosen by the user should take into account the application consumption of RAM otherwise it will lead to link issues!
For information: min value = configMINIMAL_STACK_SIZE*4

RefParameter.Name: configTOTAL_HEAP_SIZE
RefParameter.Description:
The total amount of RAM available to the RTOS kernel.
TOTAL_HEAP_SIZE setting has no effect unless heap_1.c, heap_2.c or heap_4.c are being used by the application (see Memory Management scheme parameter for more information).
Warning:
The value chosen by the user should take into account the application consumption of RAM otherwise it will lead to link issues!

RefParameter.Description:

TOTAL_HEAP_SIZE setting has no effect unless heap_1.c, heap_2.c or heap_4.c are being used by the application (see Memory Management scheme parameter for more information).
Warning:
The value chosen by the user should take into account the application consumption of RAM otherwise it will lead to link issues!
For information: min value = configMINIMAL_STACK_SIZE*4

RefParameter.Description:
The total amount of RAM available to the RTOS kernel.
TOTAL_HEAP_SIZE setting has no effect unless heap_1.c, heap_2.c or heap_4.c are being used by the application (see Memory Management scheme parameter for more information).
Warning:
The value chosen by the user should take into account the application consumption of RAM otherwise it will lead to link issues!
For information: min value = configMINIMAL_STACK_SIZE*4

RefParameter.Description:
The total amount of RAM available to the RTOS kernel.
TOTAL_HEAP_SIZE setting has no effect unless heap_1.c, heap_2.c or heap_4.c are being used by the application (see Memory Management scheme parameter for more information).
Warning:
The value chosen by the user should take into account the application consumption of RAM otherwise it will lead to link issues!
For information: min value = configMINIMAL_STACK_SIZE*4

RefParameter.Name: configTOTAL_HEAP_SIZE
RefParameter.Description:
The total amount of RAM available to the RTOS kernel.
TOTAL_HEAP_SIZE setting has no effect unless heap_1.c, heap_2.c or heap_4.c are being used by the application (see Memory Management scheme parameter for more information).
Warning:
The value chosen by the user should take into account the application consumption of RAM otherwise it will lead to link issues!
For information: min value = configMINIMAL_STACK_SIZE*4

RefParameter.Description:

TOTAL_HEAP_SIZE setting has no effect unless heap_1.c, heap_2.c or heap_4.c are being used by the application (see Memory Management scheme parameter for more information).
Warning:
The value chosen by the user should take into account the application consumption of RAM otherwise it will lead to link issues!

RefParameter.Description:
The total amount of RAM available to the RTOS kernel.
TOTAL_HEAP_SIZE setting has no effect unless heap_1.c, heap_2.c or heap_4.c are being used by the application (see Memory Management scheme parameter for more information).
Warning:
The value chosen by the user should take into account the application consumption of RAM otherwise it will lead to link issues!
For information: min value = configMINIMAL_STACK_SIZE*4

RefParameter.Name: configTOTAL_HEAP_SIZE
RefParameter.Description:
The total amount of RAM available to the RTOS kernel.
TOTAL_HEAP_SIZE setting has no effect unless heap_1.c, heap_2.c or heap_4.c are being used by the application (see Memory Management scheme parameter for more information).
Warning:
The value chosen by the user should take into account the application consumption of RAM otherwise it will lead to link issues!
For information: min value = configMINIMAL_STACK_SIZE*4

RefParameter.Name: HEAP_NUMBER
RefParameter.Description:
The RTOS kernel v8 allocates RAM each time a task, queue, mutex, software timer or semaphore is created.
To replace and improve the use of C standard libray malloc() and free() functions, the FreeRTOS download includes four sample memory allocation implementations.
The schemes are implemented in the heap_1.c, heap_2.c, heap_3.c, heap_4.c and heap5.c sources files respectively.
The schemes defined by heap_1.c, heap_2.c and heap_4.c allocate memory from a statically allocated array, known as the FreeRTOS heap.
TOTAL_HEAP_SIZE sets the size of this array. The size is specified in bytes.

RefParameter.Name: HEAP_NUMBER
RefParameter.Description:
The RTOS kernel v7 allocates RAM each time a task, queue, mutex, software timer or semaphore is created.
To replace and improve the use of C standard libray malloc() and free() functions, the FreeRTOS download includes four sample memory allocation implementations.
The schemes are implemented in the heap_1.c, heap_2.c, heap_3.c and heap_4.c sources files respectively.
The schemes defined by heap_1.c, heap_2.c and heap_4.c allocate memory from a statically allocated array, known as the FreeRTOS heap.
TOTAL_HEAP_SIZE sets the size of this array. The size is specified in bytes.

RefParameter.Name: configGENERATE_RUN_TIME_STATS
RefParameter.Group: Run time and task stats gathering related definitions
RefParameter.Description:
FreeRTOS can be configured to collect task run time statistics.
The vTaskGetRunTimeStats() API function formats the collected run time statistics into a human readable table.
GENERATE_RUN_TIME_STATS must be set to 1 (Enabled) for vTaskGetRunTimeStats() to be available.
Note: when set to 1, two empty functions are generated in the freertos.c file (to be completed by the user)

RefParameter.Name: configUSE_TRACE_FACILITY
RefParameter.Group: Run time and task stats gathering related definitions
RefParameter.Description: Set to 1 (Enabled) if you wish to include additional structure members and functions to assist with execution visualization and tracing.

RefParameter.Name: configUSE_IDLE_HOOK
RefParameter.Description:
The idle task hook function is a hook (or callback) function that, if defined and configured, will be called by the idle task on each iteration of its implementation.
- if USE_IDLE_HOOK is set to 1 (Enabled) then the application must define an idle task hook function: void vApplicationIdleHook(void).
- if USE_IDLE_HOOK is set to 0 (Disabled) then the idle task hook function will not be called, even if one is defined.
Note: when set to 1, an empty function is generated in the freertos.c file (to be completed by the user)

RefParameter.Name: configUSE_TICK_HOOK
RefParameter.Description:
The tick hook function is a hook (or callback) function that, if defined and configured, will be called during each tick interrupt.
- if USE_TICK_HOOK is set to 1 (Enabled) then the application must define a tick hook function: void vApplicationTickHook(void).
- if USE_TICK_HOOK is set to 0 (Disabled) then the tick hook function will not be called, even if one is defined.
Note: when set to 1, an empty function is generated in the freertos.c file (to be completed by the user)

RefParameter.Name: configUSE_MALLOC_FAILED_HOOK
RefParameter.Description:
The malloc() failed hook function is a hook (or callback) function that, if defined and configured, will be called if pvPortMalloc() ever returns NULL.
- NULL will be returned only if there is insufficient FreeRTOS heap memory remaining for the requested allocation to succeed.
If USE_MALLOC_FAILED_HOOK is set to 1 (Enabled) then the application must define a malloc() failed hook function: void vApplicationMallocFailedHook(void).
If USE_MALLOC_FAILED_HOOK is set to 0 (Disabled) then the malloc() failed hook function will not be called, even if one is defined.
Note: when set to 1, an empty function is generated in the freertos.c file (to be completed by the user)

RefParameter.Name: configCHECK_FOR_STACK_OVERFLOW
RefParameter.Description:
FreeRTOS provides two optional mechanisms that can be used to assist in stack overflow detection and debugging.
- when CHECK_FOR_STACK_OVERFLOW is set to 1 (option1), one mechanism is used
- when CHECK_FOR_STACK_OVERFLOW is set to 2 (option2), both mechanisms are used.
If CHECK_FOR_STACK_OVERFLOW is not set to 0 (Disabled), the application must provide a stack overflow hook (or callback) function: void vApplicationStackOverflowHook( xTaskHandle xTask, signed char *pcTaskName );
The kernel will call that stack overflow hook whenever a stack overflow is detected
Note: when set to 1 or 2, a function with an empty body is generated in the freertos.c file (to be completed by the user)

RefParameter.Name: configUSE_CO_ROUTINES
RefParameter.Description: Set to 1 to include co-routine functionality in the build, or 0 to omit co-routine functionality from the build. To include co-routines croutine.c must be included in the project.

RefParameter.Name: configMAX_CO_ROUTINE_PRIORITIES
RefParameter.Description:
Sets the maximum priority that can be assigned to a co-routine.
Co-routines can be assigned a priority from zero, which is the lowest priority to (MAX_CO_ROUTINE_PRIORITIES-1), which is the highest priority.

RefParameter.Name: configUSE_TIMERS
RefParameter.Description:
Set to 1 (Enabled) to include software timer functionality, or 0 (Disabled) to omit software timer functionality.
Note:
When enabled, memory will be allocated for the timer task: size requested (in Bytes) = 8 * configMINIMAL_STACK_SIZE.

RefParameter.Name: configUSE_TIMERS
RefParameter.Description:
Set to 1 (Enabled) to include software timer functionality.
Dependency:
Forced to 1 (Enabled) when
- xTaskGetSchedulerState equals to 0 (Disabled)
- xTimerPendFunctionCall equals to 1 (Enabled)
- or xEventGroupSetBitFromISR equals to 1 (Enabled).

RefParameter.Name: configTIMER_TASK_PRIORITY
RefParameter.Description: Sets the priority of the software timer service/daemon task.

RefParameter.Name: configTIMER_QUEUE_LENGTH
RefParameter.Description: Sets the length of the software timer command queue.

RefParameter.Name: configLIBRARY_LOWEST_INTERRUPT_PRIORITY

Condition.Expression: STM32F4 | STM32F2 | STM32F3 | STM32L1 | STM32F1 | STM32F7 | STM32L4

RefParameter.Description: The lowest interrupt priority that can be used in a call to a "set priority" function.

RefParameter.Name: configLIBRARY_LOWEST_INTERRUPT_PRIORITY
RefParameter.Description: The lowest interrupt priority that can be used in a call to a "set priority" function.

RefParameter.Name: configLIBRARY_MAX_SYSCALL_INTERRUPT_PRIORITY

Condition.Expression: STM32F4 | STM32F2 | STM32F3 | STM32L1 | STM32F1 | STM32F7 | STM32L4

RefParameter.Description:
The highest interrupt priority that can be used by any interrupt service routine that makes calls to interrupt safe FreeRTOS API functions.
DO NOT CALL INTERRUPT SAFE FREERTOS API FUNCTIONS FROM ANY INTERRUPT THAT HAS A HIGHER PRIORITY THAN THIS! (higher priorities are lower numeric values).

RefParameter.Name: configLIBRARY_MAX_SYSCALL_INTERRUPT_PRIORITY
RefParameter.Description:
The highest interrupt priority that can be used by any interrupt service routine that makes calls to interrupt safe FreeRTOS API functions.
DO NOT CALL INTERRUPT SAFE FREERTOS API FUNCTIONS FROM ANY INTERRUPT THAT HAS A HIGHER PRIORITY THAN THIS! (higher priorities are lower numeric values).

RefParameter.Name: INCLUDE_vTaskPrioritySet
RefParameter.Description:
It is one of the macros allowing those components of the real time kernel not utilized by your application to be excluded from your build.
- this ensures the RTOS does not use any more ROM or RAM than necessary for your particular embedded application.
To include the vTaskPrioritySet() API function, set vTaskPrioritySet to 1 (Enabled)
To exclude it from your build, set vTaskPrioritySet to 0 (Disabled)

RefParameter.Name: INCLUDE_uxTaskPriorityGet
RefParameter.Description:
It is one of the macros allowing those components of the real time kernel not utilized by your application to be excluded from your build.
- this ensures the RTOS does not use any more ROM or RAM than necessary for your particular embedded application.
To include the uxTaskPriorityGet() API function, set uxTaskPriorityGet to 1 (Enabled)
To exclude it from your build, set uxTaskPriorityGet to 0 (Disabled)

RefParameter.Name: INCLUDE_vTaskDelete
RefParameter.Description:
It is one of the macros allowing those components of the real time kernel not utilized by your application to be excluded from your build.
- this ensures the RTOS does not use any more ROM or RAM than necessary for your particular embedded application.
To include the vTaskDelete() API function, set vTaskDelete to 1 (Enabled)
To exclude it from your build, set vTaskDelete to 0 (Disabled)

RefParameter.Name: INCLUDE_vTaskCleanUpResources
RefParameter.Description:
It is one of the macros allowing those components of the real time kernel not utilized by your application to be excluded from your build.
- this ensures the RTOS does not use any more ROM or RAM than necessary for your particular embedded application.
To include the vTaskCleanUpResources() API function, set vTaskCleanUpResources to 1 (Enabled)
To exclude it from your build, set vTaskCleanUpResources to 0 (Disabled).
Note:

RefParameter.Name: INCLUDE_vTaskSuspend

Condition.Diagnostic: Forced to enabled (when configUSE_TICKLESS_IDLE=1 or INCLUDE_xTaskResumeFromISR=1)

RefParameter.Description:
It is one of the macros allowing those components of the real time kernel not utilized by your application to be excluded from your build.
- this ensures the RTOS does not use any more ROM or RAM than necessary for your particular embedded application.
To include the vTaskSuspend() API function, set vTaskSuspend to 1 (Enabled)
To exclude it from your build, set vTaskSuspend to 0 (Disabled)

RefParameter.Name: INCLUDE_vTaskSuspend
RefParameter.Description:
It is one of the macros allowing those components of the real time kernel not utilized by your application to be excluded from your build.
- this ensures the RTOS does not use any more ROM or RAM than necessary for your particular embedded application.
To include the vTaskSuspend() API function, set vTaskSuspend to 1 (Enabled)
To exclude it from your build, set vTaskSuspend to 0 (Disabled)

RefParameter.Name: INCLUDE_vTaskDelayUntil
RefParameter.Description:
It is one of the macros allowing those components of the real time kernel not utilized by your application to be excluded from your build.
- this ensures the RTOS does not use any more ROM or RAM than necessary for your particular embedded application.
To include the vTaskDelayUntil() API function, set vTaskDelayUntil to 1 (Enabled)
To exclude it from your build, set vTaskDelayUntil to 0 (Disabled)

RefParameter.Name: INCLUDE_vTaskDelay
RefParameter.Description:
It is one of the macros allowing those components of the real time kernel not utilized by your application to be excluded from your build.
- this ensures the RTOS does not use any more ROM or RAM than necessary for your particular embedded application.
To include the vTaskDelay() API function, set vTaskDelay to 1 (Enabled)
To exclude it from your build, set vTaskDelay to 0 (Disabled)

RefParameter.Name: INCLUDE_xTaskGetSchedulerState

Condition.Diagnostic: Both values allowed as configUSE_TIMERS is enabled

RefParameter.Description:
It is one of the macros allowing those components of the real time kernel not utilized by your application to be excluded from your build.
- this ensures the RTOS does not use any more ROM or RAM than necessary for your particular embedded application.
To include the xTaskGetSchedulerState() API function, set xTaskGetSchedulerState to 1 (Enabled)
To exclude it from your build, set xTaskGetSchedulerState to 0 (Disabled)

RefParameter.Name: INCLUDE_xTaskGetSchedulerState
RefParameter.Description:
It is one of the macros allowing those components of the real time kernel not utilized by your application to be excluded from your build.
- this ensures the RTOS does not use any more ROM or RAM than necessary for your particular embedded application.
To include the xTaskGetSchedulerState() API function, set xTaskGetSchedulerState to 1 (Enabled)
To exclude it from your build, set xTaskGetSchedulerState to 0 (Disabled).
Dependency:
Forced to 1 (Enabled) as configUSE_TIMERS equals to 0 (constraint due to the call to xPortSysTickHandler() in the interruption file)

RefParameter.Name: configUSE_ALTERNATIVE_API
RefParameter.Description:
Set to 1 to include the 'alternative' queue functions in the build, or 0 to omit the 'alternative' queue functions from the build. The alternative API is described within the queue.h header file.
Note:
The alternative API is deprecated and should not be used in new designs.

RefParameter.Name: INCLUDE_xTaskResumeFromISR

Condition.Diagnostic: Must be disabled when vTaskSuspend is disabled

RefParameter.Description:
It is one of the macros allowing those components of the real time kernel not utilized by your application to be excluded from your build.
- this ensures the RTOS does not use any more ROM or RAM than necessary for your particular embedded application.
To include the xTaskResumeFromISR() API function, set xTaskResumeFromISR and vTaskSuspend to 1 (Enabled).
To exclude it from your build, set xTaskResumeFromISR or vTaskSuspend to 0 (Disabled).

RefParameter.Name: INCLUDE_xTaskResumeFromISR
RefParameter.Description:
It is one of the macros allowing those components of the real time kernel not utilized by your application to be excluded from your build.
- this ensures the RTOS does not use any more ROM or RAM than necessary for your particular embedded application.
To include the xTaskResumeFromISR() API function, set xTaskResumeFromISR and vTaskSuspend to 1 (Enabled).
To exclude it from your build, set xTaskResumeFromISR or vTaskSuspend to 0 (Disabled).

RefParameter.Name: INCLUDE_xQueueGetMutexHolder
RefParameter.Description: Configuration constant introduced in FreeRTOS v7.2.0 that is used as the default value of xSemaphoreGetMutexHolder (if it is not explicitly set)

RefParameter.Name: INCLUDE_xSemaphoreGetMutexHolder
RefParameter.Description:
It is one of the macros allowing those components of the real time kernel not utilized by your application to be excluded from your build.
- this ensures the RTOS does not use any more ROM or RAM than necessary for your particular embedded application.
To include the xSemaphoreGetMutexHolder() API function, set xSemaphoreGetMutexHolder and USE_MUTEXES to 1 (Enabled)
To exclude it from your build, set xSemaphoreGetMutexHolder or USE_MUTEXES to 0 (Disabled).

RefParameter.Name: INCLUDE_pcTaskGetTaskName
RefParameter.Description:
It is one of the macros allowing those components of the real time kernel not utilized by your application to be excluded from your build.
- this ensures the RTOS does not use any more ROM or RAM than necessary for your particular embedded application.
To include the pcTaskGetTaskName() API function, set pcTaskGetTaskName to 1 (Enabled)
To exclude it from your build, set pcTaskGetTaskName to 0 (Disabled).

RefParameter.Name: INCLUDE_uxTaskGetStackHighWaterMark
RefParameter.Description:
It is one of the macros allowing those components of the real time kernel not utilized by your application to be excluded from your build.
- this ensures the RTOS does not use any more ROM or RAM than necessary for your particular embedded application.
To include the uxTaskGetStackHighWaterMark() API function, set uxTaskGetStackHighWaterMark to 1 (Enabled)
To exclude it from your build, set uxTaskGetStackHighWaterMark to 0 (Disabled).

RefParameter.Name: INCLUDE_xTaskGetCurrentTaskHandle
RefParameter.Description:
It is one of the macros allowing those components of the real time kernel not utilized by your application to be excluded from your build.
- this ensures the RTOS does not use any more ROM or RAM than necessary for your particular embedded application.
To include the xTaskGetCurrentTaskHandle() API function, set xTaskGetCurrentTaskHandle to 1 (Enabled)
To exclude it from your build, set xTaskGetCurrentTaskHandle to 0 (Disabled).

RefParameter.Name: INCLUDE_eTaskGetState
RefParameter.Description:
It is one of the macros allowing those components of the real time kernel not utilized by your application to be excluded from your build.
- this ensures the RTOS does not use any more ROM or RAM than necessary for your particular embedded application.
To include the eTaskGetState() API function, set eTaskGetState to 1 (Enabled)
To exclude it from your build, set eTaskGetState to 0 (Disabled).

RefParameter.Name: INCLUDE_xEventGroupSetBitFromISR

Condition.Diagnostic: Available since support of FreeRTOS v8

RefParameter.Description:
Set bits (flags) within an RTOS event group. A version of xEventGroupSetBits() that can be called from an interrupt service routine (ISR).
Note:
INCLUDE_xTimerPendFunctionCall must be set to 1 to make the xEventGroupSetBitFromISR() function available.

RefParameter.Name: INCLUDE_xEventGroupSetBitFromISR

Condition.Diagnostic: Available since support of FreeRTOS v8

RefParameter.Description:
Set bits (flags) within an RTOS event group. A version of xEventGroupSetBits() that can be called from an interrupt service routine (ISR).
Note:
INCLUDE_xTimerPendFunctionCall must be set to 1 to make the xEventGroupSetBitFromISR() function available.
Dependency:
Must be set to 0 (Disabled) when xTimerPendFunctionCall = 0 (Disabled).

RefParameter.Name: INCLUDE_xEventGroupSetBitFromISR
RefParameter.Description: Set bits (flags) within an RTOS event group. A version of xEventGroupSetBits() that can be called from an interrupt service routine (ISR)

RefParameter.Name: INCLUDE_xTimerPendFunctionCall

Condition.Diagnostic: Available since support of FreeRTOS v8

RefParameter.Description:
Used to pend the execution of a function to the RTOS daemon task (the timer service task, hence this function is pre-fixed with 'Timer').
Note:
configUSE_TIMERS must be set to 1 to make the xTimerPendFunctionCall() function available

RefParameter.Name: INCLUDE_xTimerPendFunctionCall

Condition.Diagnostic: Available since support of FreeRTOS v8

RefParameter.Description:
Used to pend the execution of a function to the RTOS daemon task (the timer service task, hence this function is pre-fixed with 'Timer').
Note:
configUSE_TIMERS must be set to 1 to make the xTimerPendFunctionCall() function available
Dependency:
Forced to 0 (Disabled) as configUSE_TIMERS is Disabled.

RefParameter.Name: INCLUDE_xTimerPendFunctionCall
RefParameter.Description: Used to pend the execution of a function to the RTOS daemon task (the timer service task, hence this function is pre-fixed with 'Timer').

RefParameter.Name: configENABLE_BACKWARD_COMPATIBILITY

Condition.Diagnostic: Available since support of FreeRTOS v8

RefParameter.Description:
The FreeRTOS.h header file includes a set of #define macros that map the names of data types used in versions of FreeRTOS prior to version 8.0.0 to the names used in FreeRTOS version 8.0.0.
The macros allow application code to update the version of FreeRTOS they are built against from a pre 8.0.0 version to a post 8.0.0 version without modification.
Setting configENABLE_BACKWARD_COMPATIBILITY to 0 in FreeRTOSConfig.h excludes the macros from the build, and in so doing allowing validation that no pre version 8.0.0 names are being used.

RefParameter.Name: configENABLE_BACKWARD_COMPATIBILITY
RefParameter.Description:
The FreeRTOS.h header file includes a set of #define macros that map the names of data types used in versions of FreeRTOS prior to version 8.0.0 to the names used in FreeRTOS version 8.0.0.
The macros allow application code to update the version of FreeRTOS they are built against from a pre 8.0.0 version to a post 8.0.0 version without modification.
Setting configENABLE_BACKWARD_COMPATIBILITY to 0 in FreeRTOSConfig.h excludes the macros from the build, and in so doing allowing validation that no pre version 8.0.0 names are being used.

RefParameter.Name: configUSE_PORT_OPTIMISED_TASK_SELECTION

Condition.Diagnostic: configUSE_PORT_OPTIMISED_TASK_SELECTION must always be disabled with M0 cortex

RefParameter.Description:
Some FreeRTOS ports have two methods of selecting the next task to execute - a generic method, and a method that is specific to that port.
The Generic method:
- Is used when configUSE_PORT_OPTIMISED_TASK_SELECTION is set to 0, or when a port specific method is not implemented.
- Can be used with all FreeRTOS ports.
- Is completely written in C, making it less efficient than a port specific method.
- Does not impose a limit on the maximum number of available priorities.
A port specific method:
- Is not available for all ports.
- Is used when configUSE_PORT_OPTIMISED_TASK_SELECTION is set to 1.
- Relies on one or more architecture specific assembly instructions (typically a Count Leading Zeros [CLZ] of equivalent instruction) so can only be used with the architecture for which it was specifically written.
- Is more efficient than the generic method.
- Typically imposes a limit of 32 on the maximum number of available priorities.

RefParameter.Name: configUSE_PORT_OPTIMISED_TASK_SELECTION

Condition.Diagnostic: configUSE_PORT_OPTIMISED_TASK_SELECTION can only be set to 1 when configMAX_PRIORITIES is less than or equal to 32

RefParameter.Description:

- Is more efficient than the generic method.
- Typically imposes a limit of 32 on the maximum number of available priorities.

RefParameter.Name: configUSE_TICKLESS_IDLE
RefParameter.Description:
By setting the configUSE_TICKLESS_IDLE, the idle task suppresses ticks and the processor stays in a low power mode for as long as possible.
When set to 1 (Enabled), two macros, configPRE_SLEEP_PROCESSING and configPOST_SLEEP_PROCESSING are generated in FreeRTOSConfig.h, and two empty functions, PreSleepProcessing and PostSleepProcessing generated in freertos.c (to be completed with user code).

RefParameter.Name: configUSE_TICKLESS_IDLE

Condition.Diagnostic: Forced to 0 (Disabled) : cannot be enabled when INCLUDE_vTaskSuspend = 0 (Disabled)

RefParameter.Description: By setting the configUSE_TICKLESS_IDLE, the idle task suppresses ticks and the processor stays in a low power mode for as long as possible.

RefParameter.Name: configUSE_TICKLESS_IDLE
RefParameter.Description: By setting the configUSE_TICKLESS_IDLE, the idle task suppresses ticks and the processor stays in a low power mode for as long as possible.

RefParameter.Name: configUSE_TASK_NOTIFICATIONS

Condition.Diagnostic: Added since support of FreeRTOS v8.2.2

RefParameter.Description:
Each RTOS task has a 32-bit notification value. An RTOS task notification is an event sent directly to a task that can unblock the receiving task, and optionally update the receiving task's notification value.
RTOS task notification functionality is enabled by default, and can be excluded from a build (saving 8 bytes per task) by setting configUSE_TASK_NOTIFICATIONS to 0 in FreeRTOSConfig.h (achieved when setting USE_TASK_NOTIFICATIONS to Disabled).

RefParameter.Name: configUSE_TASK_NOTIFICATIONS

Condition.Diagnostic: Added since support of FreeRTOS v8.2.1 (forced to one)

RefParameter.Description:
Each RTOS task has a 32-bit notification value. An RTOS task notification is an event sent directly to a task that can unblock the receiving task, and optionally update the receiving task's notification value.
RTOS task notification functionality is enabled by default, and can be excluded from a build (saving 8 bytes per task) by setting configUSE_TASK_NOTIFICATIONS to 0 in FreeRTOSConfig.h (achieved when setting USE_TASK_NOTIFICATIONS to Disabled).

RefParameter.Name: configUSE_TASK_NOTIFICATIONS
RefParameter.Description:
Each RTOS task has a 32-bit notification value. An RTOS task notification is an event sent directly to a task that can unblock the receiving task, and optionally update the receiving task's notification value.
